title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 142-2.10 - Deductions and expenses
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 142-2.10 - Deductions and expenses

State Regulations
(a) Wages shall be subject to no deductions, except for allowances authorized in
this Part, and except for deductions authorized or required by law, such as for
social security and income tax. Some examples of prohibited deductions are: (1)
deductions for spoilage or
breakage; (2)
deductions for cash
shortages or losses; (3)
fines or
penalties for lateness, misconduct or quitting by an employee without
notice. (b) The minimum
wage shall not be reduced by expenses incurred by an employee in carrying out
duties assigned by an employer. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
142-2.10

Amended

New

York State Register December 28, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 52, eff. 12/31/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
